item.title: Heritage Foods Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Heritage Foods Ltd, a small-cap player in the FMCG sector, has recently formed a Death Cross as its 50-day moving average (DMA) crossed below the 200-DMA, signalling a potential shift towards a bearish trend. This technical development, coupled with deteriorating price momentum and weak relative performance against the Sensex, raises concerns about the stock’s near- to medium-term outlook. Time: 6 minutes ago

item.title: Garware Marine Industries Ltd Forms Death Cross Signalling Bearish Trend
item.description: Garware Marine Industries Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting deteriorating momentum and long-term weakness in the stock’s price action. Time: 6 minutes ago

item.title: Sar Televenture Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: Sar Televenture Ltd has recently formed a Golden Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses above the 200-day moving average. This development often signals a potential bullish breakout and a shift in long-term momentum, suggesting that the stock may be poised for an upward trend reversal despite recent underperformance relative to the broader market. Time: 6 minutes ago

item.title: Q4 2025 Earnings Review: Broad-Based Improvement with Mid-Caps Leading Profit Growth
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has unfolded with a notable improvement in positive results, particularly among mid and small cap stocks, signalling a cautious yet optimistic market environment. With 387 companies having declared results, the aggregate data reveals sectoral disparities and evolving profit trajectories that investors should carefully analyse. Time: 6 minutes ago

item.title: BEML Land Assets Q3 FY26: Mounting Losses Signal Deepening Distress
item.description: BEML Land Assets Ltd., the demerged non-core asset holding company of BEML Ltd., reported a net loss of ₹0.46 crores for Q3 FY26, marking a marginal improvement from the ₹0.53 crore loss in Q2 FY26 but representing a deterioration from the ₹0.44 crore loss in Q3 FY25. The micro-cap NBFC, with a market capitalisation of ₹842 crores, continues to struggle with operational viability as the stock declined 1.70% following the results, trading at ₹196.60 and reflecting mounting investor concerns about the company's ability to generate positive cash flows. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Paras Defence Q3 FY26: Growth Momentum Intact Despite Margin Pressure
item.description: Paras Defence and Space Technologies Ltd., a specialised aerospace and defence manufacturer, reported consolidated net profit of ₹18.21 crores for Q3 FY26, marking a decline of 11.77% quarter-on-quarter but a robust growth of 21.08% year-on-year. The ₹5,193 crore market capitalisation company continues to demonstrate strong top-line momentum with revenue expanding 23.99% YoY to ₹106.35 crores, though margin compression remains a concern for investors. The stock has declined 3.83% following the results announcement, trading at ₹623.70 and reflecting cautious market sentiment towards the premium-valued defence play. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Adani Green Energy Q3 FY26: Sharp Losses and Mounting Financial Pressures Test Investor Confidence
item.description: Adani Green Energy Ltd., one of India's largest renewable energy companies with a project portfolio of 21,953 MW, reported a consolidated net loss of ₹41.00 crores for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), marking a dramatic reversal from the ₹583.00 crores profit recorded in the previous quarter. The 107.03% quarter-on-quarter decline represents the company's first quarterly loss in recent years, sending shockwaves through the market and triggering a sharp 14.63% stock price decline to ₹772.10 on January 23, 2026. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: D.P. Abhushan Q3 FY26: Record Quarter Masks Valuation Concerns Amid Technical Weakness
item.description: D.P. Abhushan Ltd., the Madhya Pradesh-based jewellery retailer with a market capitalisation of ₹3,344 crores, delivered a stellar operational performance in Q3 FY26, posting record quarterly net profit of ₹73.35 crores. However, the stock has struggled to translate this fundamental strength into market performance, declining 5.21% on January 23, 2026, to close at ₹1,387.95, reflecting broader technical weakness and valuation concerns that have plagued the counter over the past year. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Sampann Utpadan Q2 FY26: Strong Revenue Growth Masks Profitability Concerns
item.description: Sampann Utpadan India Ltd. (formerly S. E. Power Limited), a micro-cap industrial products manufacturer, reported Q2 FY26 net profit of ₹1.85 crores, representing marginal sequential growth of 1.09% from Q1 FY26's ₹1.83 crores. However, the year-on-year comparison reveals a stark reversal, with profits declining 263.72% from the previous year's loss of ₹1.13 crores. The company's stock has struggled significantly, trading at ₹30.70 as of January 23, 2026, down 21.16% over the past year whilst the market gained 6.56%, reflecting investor concerns about valuation and profitability sustainability. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: India Cements Q3 FY26: Turnaround Stumbles as Losses Return Despite Revenue Growth
item.description: India Cements Limited, South India's largest cement producer, reported a disappointing Q3 FY26 performance with a consolidated net loss of ₹2.67 crores, reversing the previous quarter's profit of ₹8.81 crores. Despite achieving an 18.56% year-on-year revenue growth to ₹1,114.26 crores, the company's inability to sustain profitability has raised serious concerns about operational efficiency and cost management. The stock reacted sharply, plunging 5.75% to ₹432.00 following the results announcement, reflecting investor disappointment over the fragile recovery trajectory. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Shriram Finance Q3 FY26: Strong AUM Growth Drives 9% Profit Rise Despite Margin Pressures
item.description: Shriram Finance Ltd., India's leading non-banking financial company specialising in commercial vehicle financing, reported a consolidated net profit of ₹2,529.65 crores for Q3 FY26, marking a robust 9.31% sequential growth and maintaining its position as the sector's second-largest player with a market capitalisation of ₹1,89,569 crores. The stock, trading at ₹1,003.45 as of January 23, 2026, has delivered an exceptional 89.28% return over the past year, significantly outperforming the broader market despite a modest 0.29% dip in the latest trading session. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Kirloskar Pneumatic Q3 FY26: Modest Growth Amid Valuation Concerns
item.description: Kirloskar Pneumatic Company Ltd., a prominent player in India's compressors and industrial equipment sector with a market capitalisation of ₹7,208 crores, reported a modest performance in Q3 FY26, with consolidated net profit declining 2.99% quarter-on-quarter to ₹42.20 crores despite revenue growth of 5.31%. The stock has faced significant headwinds over the past year, declining 17.56% and trading at ₹1,060.45, down 31.50% from its 52-week high of ₹1,548.00, as investors grapple with premium valuations and muted near-term momentum. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: SG Finserve Q3 FY26: Robust Growth Momentum Masks Rising Leverage Concerns
item.description: SG Finserve Ltd., a Delhi-based non-banking financial company specialising in supply chain financing solutions, reported its strongest quarterly performance in Q3 FY26 with net profit surging 14.33% quarter-on-quarter to ₹32.47 crores and an impressive 37.06% year-on-year growth. However, the stock has struggled to translate this operational momentum into market performance, declining 8.06% over the past month and trading 18.36% below its 52-week high of ₹460.60 at ₹376.05 as of January 23, 2026. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Dev Information Technology Ltd Stock Falls to 52-Week Low Amid Continued Underperformance
item.description: Shares of Dev Information Technology Ltd have declined to within 0.5% of their 52-week low, closing near Rs 30, marking a significant downturn amid broader market pressures and company-specific performance concerns. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Sundaram Clayton Ltd Stock Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs.1150
item.description: Sundaram Clayton Ltd, a key player in the Auto Components & Equipments sector, has touched a new 52-week low of Rs.1150 today, marking a significant decline amid persistent downward momentum. The stock’s recent performance reflects ongoing pressures, with a notable underperformance relative to its sector and broader market indices. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Hi-Tech Pipes Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs.75 Amidst Broad Market Weakness
item.description: Hi-Tech Pipes Ltd, a player in the Iron & Steel Products sector, touched a new 52-week low of Rs.75 today, marking a significant decline in its stock price amid broader market pressures and company-specific factors. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Airan Ltd Stock Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs.13.65 Amidst Continued Downtrend
item.description: Airan Ltd, a player in the Computers - Software & Consulting sector, recorded a fresh 52-week low of Rs.13.65 today, marking a significant decline in its stock price amid broader market pressures and company-specific performance issues. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: AVG Logistics Ltd Stock Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs.138 Amidst Continued Downtrend
item.description: Shares of AVG Logistics Ltd, a player in the Transport Services sector, declined sharply to a new 52-week low of Rs.138 on 23 Jan 2026, marking a significant milestone in the stock’s ongoing downward trajectory. This fresh low reflects a continuation of the stock’s underperformance relative to its sector and broader market indices. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Diligent Media Corporation Ltd Stock Falls to 52-Week Low Amid Continued Downtrend
item.description: Diligent Media Corporation Ltd’s stock has declined to a fresh 52-week low, closing near ₹3.25, marking a significant milestone in its ongoing downward trajectory. The stock’s recent performance reflects persistent pressures within the Media & Entertainment sector, with the share price now just 4.41% above its lowest point in the past year. Time: 2 hours ago
